Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Ordering RO happens first After RO CA happens After CA RI After RI PI After PI QC After QC PO After PO GSL After GSL D After D IC After IC RP

Name: Hypothesis Generation - NE
Text: In the context of a single order Receive Order RO and Check Availability CA are essentially a single order receipt and validation step Mapping RO CA equivalence

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Always Before If the first occurs the second should have been executed previously Mapping CA after RO RO CA in always_before RI after CA CA RI in always_before PI after RI RI PI in always_before QC after PI PI QC in always_before PO after QC QC PO in always_before GSL after PO PO GSL in always_before D after GSL GSL D in always_before IC after D D IC in always_before RP after IC IC RP in always_before

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Always After If the first activity occurs then the second activity is executed in one of the following events Directly-Follows If the first activity occurs then the second activity shall occur immediately after assume the sequence pairs for both

Name: Backtracking - NE
Text: Never Together The two activities cannot co-exist inside the same case long deliberation on pairs like PI QC QC PO PO D D IC IC RP RI PO QC IC RO RI considering sequential nature phases conflicting activities mutually exclusive ended with PI QC PO D IC RP

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Activity Occurrences Bounds the number of occurrences for an activity in a case Each activity occurs once per order RO 1 CA 1 RI 1 PI 1 QC 1 PO 1 GSL 1 D 1 IC 1 RP 1

Name: Validation - IND
Text: Double Check Constraints Equivalence RO CA must occur same number Always Before sequence correct Activ Freq all once Directly Follows sequence correct Final Construction dictionary with sets of tuples

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: Self-Correction Refinement check structures equivalence set of tuples always_before always_after directly_follows same sequence never_together few pairs activ_freq all 1
